intro: Selago incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved selago, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a serrated edge, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a cluster. Selago incisa is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
